headline: Disney is Close to Picking Parks Chief D’Amaro as Next CEO
summary: D’Amaro, 54, has led the unit that delivers most of Disney’s profits since 2020.  If approved, D’Amaro will succeed Bob Iger, who ran the world’s largest entertainment company from 2005 to 2020 and returned as CEO in 2022.  “The board has not yet selected the next CEO of the Walt Disney Co. and once that decision is made, we will announce it,” a Disney spokesperson said in an emailed statement.

content.title: Disney is Close to Picking Parks Chief D’Amaro as Next CEO
content.summary: D’Amaro, 54, has led the unit that delivers most of Disney’s profits since 2020.  If approved, D’Amaro will succeed Bob Iger, who ran the world’s largest entertainment company from 2005 to 2020 and returned as CEO in 2022.  “The board has not yet selected the next CEO of the Walt Disney Co. and once that decision is made, we will announce it,” a Disney spokesperson said in an emailed statement.

headline: Disney's first quarter is powered by box-office hits 'Zootopia 2' and 'Avatar: Fire and Ash'
summary: Disney posted a strong first quarter, powered by box-office hits “Zootopia 2” and “Avatar: Fire and Ash. The Walt Disney Co. earned $2.4 billion, or $1.34 per share, for the three months ended Dec. 27. It earned $2.64 billion, or $1.40 per share, a year ago.

headline: Disney’s (NYSE:DIS) Q4 CY2025 Sales Top Estimates
summary: Global entertainment and media company Disney (NYSE:DIS) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.2% year on year to $25.98 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.63 per share was 3.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Disney’s (NYSE:DIS) Q4 CY2025 Sales Top Estimates
content.summary: Global entertainment and media company Disney (NYSE:DIS) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.2% year on year to $25.98 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.63 per share was 3.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

thumbnail.caption: DIS Cover Image

headline: Palantir Earnings Arrive Just as Stock Could Use Some Good News
summary: Shares of the software company have tumbled 29% from their November peak, reached right before Palantir last reported results, and are down 18% to start 2026, putting them among the 15 worst performers in the S&P 500 this year.  While the selloff has cut into Palantir’s valuation, shares still trade for roughly 142 times expected earnings, the third-highest multiple in the S&P 500.

content.title: Palantir Earnings Arrive Just as Stock Could Use Some Good News
content.summary: Shares of the software company have tumbled 29% from their November peak, reached right before Palantir last reported results, and are down 18% to start 2026, putting them among the 15 worst performers in the S&P 500 this year.  While the selloff has cut into Palantir’s valuation, shares still trade for roughly 142 times expected earnings, the third-highest multiple in the S&P 500.

headline: Disney's 'next gen' of leadership will enable future growth
summary: While Disney (DIS) reported better than expected fiscal first quarter results — marked by growth in its theme park sales — the search for a new CEO to replace Bob Iger narrows. Reports point to Disney Experiences chairman Josh D'Amaro as a likely candidate in the process. Laffer Tengler Investments CEO and CIO Nancy Tengler weighs in on Disney's earnings results and the impact a long-awaited leadership change could mean for the company and its growth. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Disney's 'next gen' of leadership will enable future growth
content.description:
While Disney (DIS) reported better than expected fiscal first quarter results — marked by growth in its theme park sales — the search for a new CEO to replace Bob Iger narrows. Reports point to Disney Experiences chairman Josh D'Amaro as a likely candidate in the process.

Laffer Tengler Investments CEO and CIO Nancy Tengler weighs in on Disney's earnings results and the impact a long-awaited leadership change could mean for the company and its growth.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
content.summary: While Disney (DIS) reported better than expected fiscal first quarter results — marked by growth in its theme park sales — the search for a new CEO to replace Bob Iger narrows. Reports point to Disney Experiences chairman Josh D'Amaro as a likely candidate in the process. Laffer Tengler Investments CEO and CIO Nancy Tengler weighs in on Disney's earnings results and the impact a long-awaited leadership change could mean for the company and its growth. headline: Disney theme parks help boost earnings above Wall Street forecasts
summary:
STORY: Walt Disney beat revenue and earnings projections for the holiday quarter.

The entertainment giant on Monday (February 2) credited its theme parks and the movie 'Zootopia 2'

Disney's parks, cruises and consumers products units carried the period.

They made $10 billion in revenue and just under three quarters of the company's operating profit of close to $5 billion.

Walt Disney World particularly performed strongly compared to a year earlier.

That was when Hurricane Milton forced Orlando-based attractions to close.

The company's overall revenue rose 5% to $26 billion for its fiscal first quarter ended late December - just ahead of analyst forecasts.

Disney's entertainment unit includes the company's film studios, television networks and streaming services.

It reported revenue of $11.6 billion in the quarter, up 7% from a year ago.

It was driven by holiday releases, including "Zootopia 2."

Data shows the Disney animated sequel brought in nearly $1.8 billion in worldwide ticket sales.

Another Disney project - "Avatar: Fire and Ash" - grossed $1.4 billion globally.

However, the entertainment unit reported operating profit fell just over a third year-over-year.

It put that on the costs of marketing "Avatar" and eight other films.

Disney's streaming services saw revenue rise to $4.4 billion, up 13% from a year ago. 

Looking ahead, the company held its full-year forecast of double-digit per-share earnings growth.

It estimates it will bring in $19 billion in cash from operations, and believes it's on track to repurchase $7 billion in stock.

Disney is also expected to name a new chief executive to replace Bob Iger early this year.

Hollywood executives believe Josh D'Amaro is the front-runner.

He is currently chairman of the experiences division.

content.title: Disney theme parks help boost earnings above Wall Street forecasts

headline: Disney Outlook Disappoints as It Prepares For a New CEO
summary: Walt Disney Co. reported sales and earnings for its fiscal first quarter that exceed analysts' expectations. headline: Disney earnings boosted by theme parks, as CEO handover nears
summary: The Walt Disney Company on Monday reported quarterly earnings showing that streaming services gained momentum and theme-park revenue hit record levels, but the company warned of a possible slowdown in the United States.Net profit reached $2.48 billion, down 6 percent year-over-year, according to a statement, with the Experiences division -- Disney's theme parks and resorts -- delivering record quarterly revenue of $10.0 billion.

headline: Disney CEO succession in focus: Who is Josh D'Amaro?
summary: Disney (DIS) is expected to name CEO Bob Iger's successor this week. Multiple reports say that Disney Entertainment's co-chair, Dana Walton, and Disney Experiences chairman, Josh D'Amaro, are the two candidates. According to Bloomberg, D'Amaro is the frontrunner. Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman explains what investors should know about D'Amaro. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Disney CEO succession in focus: Who is Josh D'Amaro?
content.description:
Disney (DIS) is expected to name CEO Bob Iger's successor this week.

Multiple reports say that Disney Entertainment's co-chair, Dana Walton, and Disney Experiences chairman, Josh D'Amaro, are the two candidates. According to Bloomberg, D'Amaro is the frontrunner.

Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman explains what investors should know about D'Amaro.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Disney succession: Is it time for CEO Bob Iger to 'move on?'
summary: Disney stock (DIS) is coming under some pressure on Monday after the media giant reported fiscal first quarter results that topped earnings and revenue estimates. Bloomberg also reported that the company is close to naming the chairman of its theme park division, Josh D'Amaro, as the next CEO and succeeding Bob Iger. Gabelli Funds Co-CIO of Value Chris Marangi comes on Market Catalysts to react to Disney's latest stock moves in relation to the latest succession headlines. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Disney shares slump as its theme parks see fewer international visitors
summary: Walt Disney's warning that a decline in international visitors to its U.S. theme parks and a slump in earnings at its TV and film division sent shares down nearly 5% in trading on Monday, just as ​it readies a successor to outgoing CEO Bob Iger.  The company said there were "headwinds" among international visitors without giving a reason at a ‌time when foreign travel to the United States has been waning.  CFO Hugh Johnston added that Disney is focusing promotional efforts on U.S. consumers, as it has "less visibility" into international visitors.

content.title: Disney shares slump as its theme parks see fewer international visitors
content.summary: Walt Disney's warning that a decline in international visitors to its U.S. theme parks and a slump in earnings at its TV and film division sent shares down nearly 5% in trading on Monday, just as ​it readies a successor to outgoing CEO Bob Iger.  The company said there were "headwinds" among international visitors without giving a reason at a ‌time when foreign travel to the United States has been waning.  CFO Hugh Johnston added that Disney is focusing promotional efforts on U.S. consumers, as it has "less visibility" into international visitors.

headline: Disney: Where investors can find value in the media giant
summary: Disney stock (DIS) is coming under some pressure on Monday after the media giant reported fiscal first quarter results that topped earnings and revenue estimates. Bloomberg also reported that the company is close to naming the chairman of its theme park division, Josh D'Amaro, as the next CEO and succeeding Bob Iger. Gabelli Funds Co-CIO of Value Chris Marangi comes on Market Catalysts to talk more about how the media giant is positioning itself to survive and thrive in the AI era, noting Disney's content licensing partnership with OpenAI's Sora platform (OPAI.PVT). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Disney’s Q1 2026 Missed Hype, But the Turnaround Builds
summary: Dividend-paying Disney stock is on the cusp of a major market reversal that will drive a sustained, multi-year uptrend fueled by growth and capital returns.
